channel.title: LOOK: Web Developer Questions
channel.description:
I'm not the person to ask questions around here as I use google a lot for my resources, but this one I cannot find. I have never seen anyone yet to mention great sites that they have [b]subscribed[/b] to, like: [url=http://dzineblog.com/][b]Dzine Blog[/b][/url], [url=http://www.grafpedia.com/]Graf Pedia[/url], [url=http://psdvibe.com/][b]PSD Vibe[/b][/url], [url=http://hv-designs.co.uk/][b]HV Designs[/b][/url], [url=http://www.tutorial9.net/]Tutorial 9[/url], [url=http://www.pvmgarage.com/]PVM Garage[/url], etc.
Have you subscribed to a Web Profession's Blog before/already? If so, what was/is the name of it and what all do you remember that you have learned from it?
Over here I have learned many things for someone who strives a lot :p. I learned to use GIMP better obviously though, there are some basic things which I never knew of until a few days ago that actually decreased my works elapsed time :cool:. I'm hoping to see some of you guys have subscribed to those/these awesome sites out there :D though. My reason for saying this is because these guys actually post good information, they don't just post tutorials and codes, but they also give tips and resources that ease or/and increase your capabilities.

item.title: LOOK: Web Developer Questions
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

I don’t ever subscribe to RSS Feeds or anything like that.

I just practice, practice, practice, and look at other sites that amuse me and see why it amuses me. And of course build up on technique.

Read full topic

item.title: LOOK: Web Developer Questions
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I don’t subscribe to webblogs, I bookmark some and I’ll check on them occasionally. But no, I don’t spend every waking moment watching my RSS feed on an update. As for who I subscribe too, it’s mainly just advertisement designers, or guys in graphic design. Only the ones that are ‘in the biz’.

There are many guys out there that do some of the most well known work, but no one ever sees the artist behind it. There’s a whole world of Graphic Designers that have websites, but aren’t mainstream, you have too look for them. I go to those guys for inspiration in what I do.

Read full topic
